Fitur 'Percakapan Rahasia' Mau Sambangi Facebook Messenger
05 Nov 2019, 09:13 by Josina - detikInet


Ilustrasi Facebook Messenger. (Foto: istimewa)

Jakarta - Facebook dilaporkan sedang melalukan pengujian fitur penyandian atau enkripsi end-to-end untuk panggilan video dan audio di aplikasi Messenger.Hadirnya fitur keamanan yang dinamai 'Secret Conversation' (percakapan rahasia) ini akan mengamankan panggilan video ataupun audio pengguna agar lebih rahasia dan tidak mudah disadap oleh peretas. "Facebook Messenger sedang menguji panggilan Video dan Audio melalui Percakapan Rahasia," tulis Jane Manchun Wong di Twitter. Jane adalah pembocor fitur-fitur anyar di aplikasi populer.



Dalam gambar yang ia unggah, menampilkan Messenger yang bertuliskan "Secret Conversation" (percakapan rahasia). Pada bagian bawahnya juga diberikan keterangan bahwa percakapan tersebut telah terenkripsi.Untuk mengaktifkannya cukup ketuk ikon 'Pesan Baru' di sudut kanan atas Messenger dan kemudian pilih 'Rahasia'. Nantinya ikon panggilan audio dan video di sudut kanan atas akan hilang.CEO Facebook Mark Zuckerberg memang telah berjanji akan memperbaiki plaformnya agar lebih fokus pada privasi pengguna. Fitur enkripsi ini direncanakan akan diterapkan di seluruh aplikasinya seperti Instagram, setelah lebih dulu ada di WhatsApp."Komunikasi pribadi orang-orang harus aman. Enkripsi end-to-end mencegah siapapun - termasuk kita - dari melihat apa yang dibagikan orang pada layanan kami," tulisnya. 'Secret Conversation' Feature Want to Connect Facebook Messenger
05 Nov 2019, 09:13 by Josina - detikInet


Illustration of Facebook Messenger. (Photo: special)

Jakarta - Facebook is reportedly doing testing end-to-end encryption or encryption features for video and audio calls in the Messenger application. The presence of a security feature called 'Secret Conversation' will keep users' video or audio calls secure and more confidential and not easily bugged by hackers. "Facebook Messenger is testing Video and Audio calls through Secret Conversations," Jane Manchun Wong wrote on Twitter. Jane is a leak of new features in popular applications.



In the picture he uploaded, displays Messenger that reads "Secret Conversation" (secret conversations). At the bottom it also gives information that the conversation has been encrypted. To activate it simply tap the 'New Message' icon in the upper right corner of Messenger and then select 'Secret'. Later the audio and video call icon in the upper right corner will disappear. CEO Facebook Mark Zuckerberg has indeed promised to improve the platform to focus more on user privacy. This encryption feature is planned to be implemented in all applications such as Instagram, after first on WhatsApp. "People's personal communication must be safe. End-to-end encryption prevents anyone - including us - from seeing what people are sharing on our services, "he wrote. Check out the video "Now Can Share WhatsApp Status to Facebook Story Loh!"
